page.title: 01DALMILLING/WHITLETTS,AYR.
page.content: On the eastern boundary of the large coastal fishing port of Ayr,is the district known as Dalmilling and Whitletts.This is a fairly extensive {council estate}which grew up around the mining village of Whitletts. Building of houses commenced in 1948 and continued until 1955,providing homes for many families. Living beside open countryside,mainly farmland and small areas of woodland, through which the River Ayr meanders, the people of this urban area are able to enjoy the benefits of both town and country. One main road from the town centre, which runs through this area,leading to a large roundabout from which roads branch:_ (a)northwards to Kilmarnock (b)eastwards to Mauchline (c)southwards to Girvan and Stranraer.
